newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq says it downed pilotless plane in south.
newsitem.headline: Iraq says it downed pilotless plane in south.

text.p: The government al-Jumhouriya newspaper said on Wednesday Iraqi anti-aircraft gunners shot down a "hostile pilotless plane" over its southern province of Missan.
But the paper did not say whether the plane belonged to the United States which fired cruise missiles against Iraqi air defence targets on Tuesday and Wednesday.
The downing of the plane was not reported by the official Iraqi News Agency (INA) and was not confirmed by the Iraqi General Command which has so far issued two communiques on U.S. missile strikes.
Jumhouriya said Iraqi civil defence experts found that the plane was made in the United States in 1985.
